class.name: SkinReference
class.brief_description: A reference-counted holder object for a skeleton RID used in the [RenderingServer].
class.description: An internal object containing a mapping from a [Skin] used within the context of a particular [SEMesh] to refer to the skeleton's [RID] in the RenderingServer. See also [method SEMesh.get_skin_reference] and [method RenderingServer.instance_attach_skeleton]. Note that despite the similar naming, the skeleton RID used in the [RenderingServer] does not have a direct one-to-one correspondence to a [Skeleton3D] node. In particular, a [Skeleton3D] node with no [SEMesh] children may be unknown to the [RenderingServer]. On the other hand, a [Skeleton3D] with multiple [SEMesh] nodes which each have different [member SEMesh.skin] objects may have multiple SkinReference instances (and hence, multiple skeleton [RID]s).

method.name: get_skeleton
method.description: Returns the [RID] owned by this SkinReference, as returned by [method RenderingServer.skeleton_create].

method.name: get_skin
method.description: Returns the [Skin] connected to this SkinReference. In the case of [SEMesh] with no [member SEMesh.skin] assigned, this will reference an internal default [Skin] owned by that [SEMesh]. Note that a single [Skin] may have more than one [SkinReference] in the case that it is shared by meshes across multiple [Skeleton3D] nodes.
